mng: demonic, iniquitous, nefarious, evil, unhealthy influences that cause disease (Chinese medicine)

exm.mng: demonic, iniquitous, nefarious, evil, unhealthy influences that cause disease (Chinese medicine)
evil influence, unhealthy trend, pathogeny (cause of disease) in TCM, as opposed to vital energy 正氣|正气[zheng4 qi4]
to ward off evil spirits, mythical lion-like animal that wards off evil (also called 貔貅[pi2 xiu1])
opposition between vital energy 正氣|正气[zheng4 qi4] and pathogeny 邪氣|邪气[xie2 qi4] (TCM)
wicked idea, evil thought, evil desire
to exorcise, to drive away evil spirits
to mend one's ways (idiom), to turn over a new leaf
to be possessed, to be bewitched
pathogeny (cause of disease) in TCM, as opposed to vital energy 正氣|正气[zheng4 qi4]
